title: (x) vintage vinyl sleeves - New Zelek, Helvetica, custom lettering {Rainer}
content:
Looking for some help identifying the typefaces used here

Or

The typefaces used as a base that were then customized.

Cheers!
author: shanejlong

comments.content:
Not sure if the images got uploaded...

here they are.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sleeve2_4770.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sleeve17_5803.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sleeve28_4449.jpg)

George Shearing: I think I read somewhere about a predigital typeface which was revived by Paratype as [New Zelek](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429/http:/www.paratype.com/pstore/fonts/New-Zelek.htm). EDIT: Yes, it was an [Mecanorma-typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429/http:/www.typophile.com/node/7548) as Mark Simonson told here.

Cristal looks like the bastard-son from [Soda Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/soda-script/) and [Candice](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/candice-lt/).

45 T. GEANT looks like simply Helvetica.

For Mandre you could start by searching here for a typeface called » [Baby Teeth](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429/http:/www.google.at/search?hl=de&q=%22baby+teeth+site%3Atypophile.com&btnG=Google-Suche&meta=)" from Milton Glaser (not digitized until now, there should be lots of suggestions for alternates inside the threads).

_For Mandre you could start by searching here for a typeface called »Baby Teeth” from Milton Glaser (not digitized until now..._

Not digitized, true, but there is a version, made by ParaType, called [**Bebit**](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209213429/http:/www.paratype.com/pstore/fonts/Bebit.htm).
